conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Influenza is a viral infection that attacks your respiratory system — your nose, throat and lungs
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: P.S: See a doctor for proper prescription and tretment. Taking antiviral drugs may reduce the length of your illness and help prevent more-serious problems.

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Depression is classified as a mood disorder. It may be described as feelings of sadness, loss, or anger that interfere with a person’s everyday activities.
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: P.S: Talk to a healthCare provider. Psycotherapy, antidepressants, antianxiety, antipsychotic medications and excersis can help

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Diarrhoea is passing loose or watery bowel movements 3 or more times in a day (or more frequently than usual).
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: Take plenty of fluids, retrict diet, see a health specialist if symptoms persist

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Malaria is a life-threatening disease. It’s typically transmitted through the bite of an infected Anopheles mosquito.
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: Treatment for the disease is typically provided in a hospital. Your doctor will prescribe medications based on the type of parasite that you have.

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Typhoid is a bacterial infection that can lead to a high fever, diarrhea, and vomiting. It can be fatal.
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: P.S: See a Doctor. The only effective treatment for typhoid is antibiotics. The most commonly used are ciprofloxacin (for non-pregnant adults) and ceftriaxone. Other than antibiotics, it is important to rehydrate by drinking adequate water. In more severe cases, where the bowel has become perforated, surgery may be required.

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Asthma is an inflammatory disease of the airways to the lungs. It makes breathing difficult and can make some physical activities challenging or even impossible.
symptoms: coughing, especially at night, when laughing, or during exercise
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: breathing exercises, quick-acting treatments, long-term asthma control medications, Your doctor will recommend one treatment or combination of treatments based on the type of asthma you have, your age, your triggers

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Diabetes mellitus, commonly known as diabetes, is a metabolic disease that causes high blood sugar.
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: Doctors treat diabetes with a few different medications

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Coronaviruses are a family of viruses that can cause illnesses such as the common cold, severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS).
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: Tell your health care team about your symptoms and possible exposure before you go to your appointment.

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Arthritis is the swelling and tenderness of one or more of your joints.
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: Analgesics, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Menthol or capsaicin creams, Immunosuppressants like prednisone or cortisone help reduce inflammation.

conditions_with_symptoms.desc: Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) is a developmental disability  that can cause significant social, communication and behavioral challenges. There is often nothing about how people with ASD look that sets them apart from other people, but people with ASD may communicate, interact, behave, and learn in ways that are different from most other people.
conditions_with_symptoms.treatment: Currently, no treatment has been shown to cure ASD, but several interventions have been developed and studied for use with young children.
